intro: Leucopodum campestre, commonly known as the meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairless. Its flowers are pink to purple, with five petals and a prominent central spur, and bloom from June to August. It thrives in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
